result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Demars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SPD Appointment - Attorney Jefren Olsen
Denying Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief Motion Under Wis. Stat. 809.30 and 974.02.
from Postconviction Motion Hearing
Proposed Order Denying Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Motion Under Wis. Stat. 809.30 and 974.02

(Case called at 1:40 PM)
Defendant Michael D. Demars appears in custody with Attorney Jefren Olsen.  Attorney Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court outlines what it believes to be the basis for the postconviction motion and how matters should proceed for today's purposes.  It is determined to begin with testimony from Attorney Erika Amundson.  Attorney Erika Amundson is called by Attorney Olsen to the stand- sworn and testifies.  No cross-examination by the State.  Attorney Erika Amundson steps down and is released.  Parties make statements regarding the video of the police interview and transcripts (partial and full) prepared in association with the video.  Video previously marked as Exhibit #1, and full transcript marked as Exhibit #2.  Exhibit #2 received by Court.  Video played in sections for the Court (start and stop times noted on the record).  State makes argument against motion.  Defense makes additional arguments for postconviction motion.  Court denies the postconviction motions and explains reasons why.  Court finds that the basis for the claim that there was ineffective assistance of trial counsel was not met on its face and also finds that there was probable cause to draft and execute a search warrant in this case.  Court denies motion for Defendant to withdraw his plea.  Defense will e-file a proposed order for the Court to sign.  Exhibits #1 and #2 are both received by Court.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief Under Wis. Stats.  809.30 &  974.02
